Services: Provides medical, behavioral, pediatrics, and dental services for both insured a n d uninsured individuals. They offer a payscale discount for uninsured patients.

Services: Provides medical a n d behavioral services for both insured a n d uninsured individuals. They offer a payscale discount for uninsured patients.

Services: Provides free women's services for the uninsured. Must be 18 to 64 years old and present a photo I.D. Those younger than 81 years old are accepted if pregnant.The mobile clinic also serves rural areas a n d provides limited services for m e n such a s blood work.

Hours of Operations: Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
Services: Call to get help with applying for Medicaid.

OrganizationName: Hector P. Garcia Memorial Family Health Center

Services: Family practice offers specialty clinics, laboratory and imaging services; a pharmacy with interior and drive-through access, and more. Accepts Nueces County Clinic Card. Does not a c c e p t "Self-Pay" Patients.

Hours of Operations: Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 11:45 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. to 3:45 p.m.
Services: Provides free healthcare, medical care, and medication assistance for insured and uninsured individuals. Vision Care is available on the first Monday of every month. Please call ahead fo availability.

Hours of Operations: Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and closed every day, 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m.
Services: Provides free medical, vision care and a Medication Assistance Program (MAP). Other educational classes offered include diabetes, nutrition, and cooking classes.

Hours of Operations: Monday through Thursday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., and Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

OrganizationName: South Texas Family Planning Clininc- Corpus Christi
Address: 4455 South Padre Island Drive, Suite #30, Corpus Christi
Hours of Operations: Monday and Thursday: 8:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., Tuesday and Wednesday: 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., Friday: 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.,                   Closed Wednesdays 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m.

Services: Free or Low-Cost family planning, birth control, STD testing and treatment, breast and cervical cancer care, immunizations and preventative primary healthcare. Same day services available. New patients accepted. Walk-ins are welcome. For more information visit: www.STFPHC.org

Hours of Operations: Times vary. Please call for more information on current hours.
Services: Dental services are provided once a month. As of June 2023, the first month of availbility for appointments is October 2023. However, please still call and get on the waiting/ cancellation list for an opporunity to receive services. Ask for Olivia when calling. Medical services: A board-certified M.D. family medicine doctor is available Monday through Wednesda and Friday (not Thursday) to uninsured patients only.

Hours of Operations: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., and Tuesday and Thursday 8:15 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.
Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., and Tuesday and Thursday 8:15 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

Address: 3875 S. Staples Street, Suite 4, Corpus Christi
Services: Choice Living Community provides support and assistance through community planning for adults with disabilities who need job coaching. They provide on-site job training, coaching for those adults who can maintain a part-time position, and in-house training for adults who are not able to retain part- or full-time employement. They offer continued life skills training in personal hygiene, cooking, laundry, money skills, and socialization ina. secure enviroment. This site offers day programming for adults living with dissabilities.

Must become a resident in the facility in order to work for them. Provides Housing along with three (3) meals a day and work for all residents. The process will begin with an in-take interview. In-take interviews are available Monday through Friday from 9:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. Applicants must provide an I.D. and a social security card.
Provides help to find employement while living in a dormitory environment.

Hours of Operations: This service is on a first come first serve basis/must arrive between 9:00 a.m.-9:30 a.m. in order to be interviewed for the job/housing service.
Services: This is a work program housing facility. It is NOT a shelter or temporary housing facility. Applicants must pass TB and Covid-19 test/vaccination.

Hours of Operations: This service is on a first come first serve basis/must arrive between 9:00 a.m.-9:30 a.m. in order to be interviewed for the job/housing service.
Services: This is a work program housing facility. It is NOT a shelter or temporary housing facility. Applicants must pass TB and Covid-19 test/vaccination.
Transition Services helps people with disabilities prepare for a career exploration, work-based learning, counseling on postsecondary opportunities, self-advocacy, and workplace readiness.

Hours of Operations: Call for help with finding shelter and/or housing needs.

Services: Assists pregnant women who are not pregnant, their dependant children, and newborn babies with emergency shelter, transitional housing, support, food, clothing, baby items, counseling, education, medical and other assistance. They also help women who may have been victims of domestic violence, have issues with addiction, and/or may be homeless. Hope House opens the doors to women who may just be alone and need assistance.
Provides help with finding employement while living in a dormitory environment.

Hours of Operations: Provides breakfast Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 8:30 a.m. Lunch from 11:00 a.m. to 11:30 a.m.
Services: Shower and laundry facilities are available for FREE to homeless individuals with proof of TB and COVID-19 tests.

Provides housing for victims of sexual assault and domestic violence only. They are able to house men, women, and children as well as families while providing three (3) meals a day and toiletries. Case management, counseling, and legal aide advocates are available to help enroll children in both school and day care facilities.

Provides veterans help with the deposit and one (1) to two (2) months' rent depending on the total cost. Must have a birth certificate, social security card, I.D., and a DD-214 to qualify. Starting July 1, 2023, funds are available, but they will always take applications. Ask for Carrie when calling.

Provides residents help with the deposit and one (1) to two (2) months' rent depending on the total cost. Must have a birth certificate, social security card, and I.D. to qualify. Starting October 2023, funds are available, but they will always take applications. If you were evicted, you will need to provide that notice. Surviving spouses of veterans can qualify for ESG Rapid Re-housing, and funding will be available starting July 2023. Ask for Carrie when calling.
This is a Medication Assistance Program (MAPS).

Hours of Operations: Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 11:45 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. to 3:45 p.m.
Services: Provides free health care, medical care, and medication assistance for both insured and uninsured individuals. Vision care is available the first Monday of every month (please call ahead for availability) Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Address: 10501 South Padre Island Drive, Corpus Christi
Services: This organization provides prescription medication assistance (Must pass on-site drug screen). Limited to prescription medications that have no street value.
This organization provides housing with counseling and employement help.

This location offers the following programs: adult outpatient and short-term residential services, withdrawal management, supportive residential treatment, intensive residential treatment, recovery housing, and recovery support services.

OrganizationName: South Texas Substance Abuse Recovery Services (STSARS)
Services: The program administers the dosing of Methadone and also provides lab work and counseling.

OrganizationName: SAIL (Substance Abusers Inviting Life Program)- A Branch of STSARS
Address: 1204 Leopard Street, Suite E, Corpus Christi
Services: Adult services offer a variety of outpatient and court-ordered programs to address the substance abuse needs of individuals residing in the Coastal Bend area. Most services are free. Visits are always confidential.

OrganizationName: COPSD (Co-Occurring Psychiatric And Substance Use Disorders Proram)- A Branch of STSARS
Address: 1205 Leopard Street, Suite C, Corpus Christi
Services: The program emphasizes integrated services where both psychiatric and substance-abuse disorders are seen as primary. Case management is provided to ensure client stabilization, service coordination, and engagement strategies to assist clients in benefiting from treatment.

Address: 1205 Leopard Street, Suite C, Corpus Christi
Services: The program is committed to helping people ages 13 to 17 and their families with substance abuse recovery services.

Address: 3875 S. Staples Street, Suite 4, Corpus Christi
Services: Choice Living Community provides support and assistance through community planning for adults with dissabilities who need job coaching. They provide on-site job training, coaching for those adults who can maintain a part-time position, and in-house training for adults who are not able to retain part- or full- time employement. They offer continued life skills training in personal hygiene, cooking, laundry, money skills, and socialization in a secure environment. This site offers day programming for adults living with disabilities.

OrganizationName: Nueces Center for Mental Health and Intellectual Disabilities
Services: This location provides help to residents of Nueces County, ages 3 to 17, with a diagnosis of mental illness who exhibit serious emotional, behavioral, or mental disorders. This includes individuals with intellectual disabilities, autism, or a pervasive developmental disorder, or schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, major depression, or others. Individuals who do not meet eligibility criteria will be referred to other services available in the community.

Hours of Operations: The center serves nine (9) surrounding counties, Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Services: The Coastal Plains Community Center provides services to persons with intellectual and developmental disabilities. All services are based on individual needs.

Mission 911 uses a holistic approach to helping displaced people by holding anger management groups, life skills groups and substance abuse intervension programs using a cognitive/behavioral approach.

Address: 1801 S. Alameda Street, Ste 150, Corpus Christi
Services: The organization provides parenting classes as well as anger management counseling.

OrganizationName: COPSD (Co-Occurring Psychiatric And Substance Use Disorders Proram)
Address: 1205 Leopard Street, Suite C, Corpus Christi
Services: The program emphasizes integrated services where both psychiatric and substance-abuse disorders are seen as primary. Case management is provided to ensure client stabilization, service coordination, and engagement strategies to assist clients in benefiting from treatment.

Hours of Operations: Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Services: Provides individualized diabetes self-management education and support from registered nurses, registered dietitians, and community health workers. Call to enroll in Free one-day classes and series classes which are avaialable every month.

OrganizationName: COASTAL COMPASS- Education and Career Resource Center
Hours of Operations: Monday through Friday, 10:30 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.
Services: Partnerships with area schools and work-related training programs connect you with experienced counselors to offer you FREE step by step assistance and support in career development, education, GED preparation, adult literacy programs, and English as a second language instruction. Visit Coastal Compass at La Palmera Mall (at the Macy's/parking garage entrance). Ask for Kristen Parris when calling.

Hours of Operations: Provides breakfast Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 8:30 a.m. Lunch from 11:00 a.m. to 11:30 a.m.
Services: Shower and laundry facilities are available for FREE to homeless individuals with proof of TB and COVID-19 tests.

Hours of Operations: Provides lunch, Monday through Friday, 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m., and dinner, 5:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m.
Services: Available to anyone.

Hours of Operations: Provides a clothing closet, Tuesday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.
Services: The organization also provides help with water/electricity (TXU and Ambit) using Texasutilityhelp.com

Hours of Operations: Every Thursday.
Services: Serves food every Thursday to the first 40 people. Must be a Corpus Christi resident.

Hours of Operations: Monday through Thursday, 7:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.
Services: Provides a food pantry, Monday through Thursday, 7:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. (Current proof of residence is required.) One (1) per household and current proof of residence is required.
Call to apply for food stamps.

Provides housing along with three (3) meals a day and work for all residents. The process will begin with an in-take interview. In-take interviews are available Monday through Friday after 9:00 a.m. and no later than 10:00 p.m. Applicants must provide an I.D. and a social security card.

Hours of Operations: Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
Services: Call or visit the Food Bank of Corpus Christi to get help with applying for food stamps.

Hours of Operations: A food pantry is available the first Tuesday and Wednesday of every month from 8:30 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

OrganizationName: St. Philip the Apostle Catholic Church
Services: Provides community support.

Hours of Operations: A food pantry is open every day from 9:30 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

Address: 10501 South Padre Island Drive, Corpus Christi
Services: Free meals are provided to zip codes 78418 and 78419, Monday through Friday, 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. The food pantry is open from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. The facility provides four (4) newly remodeled showers (2 men/ 2 women), Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 11:30 a.m., and three (3) washers and dryers, Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. TB/COVID-19 tests are NOT required for any of these services.
Mission 911 provides help with water/electricity (TXU and Ambit) using Texasutilityhelp.com. A clothing closet is also available Tuesday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

Hours of Operations: Monday through Thursday, 7:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.
Services: Catholic Charities offers utility help when available. No funding will be available for utilities until 2023.

Provides housing along with three (3) meals a day and work for all residents. The process will begin with an in-take interview. In-take interviews are available Monday through Friday after 9:00 a.m. and no later than 10:00 p.m. Applicants must provide an I.D. and a social security card.

Water and electricity are funded every October and are first come first served. Call for approval to move forward with the application process. Works with TXU, Ambit, Reliant, and other major electric companies. Receives the funding annually in October to be used by the end of the working year. Rent assistance is funded every November and is first come first served as well. Ask for Carmen for help with these programs.

Grant funds are still available for utilities, mortgage payments, and/or rent to anyone who lost their job or any work hours due to COVID-19. A letter from an employer is required. Hope House also has their annual grant fund for evictions, 3-day notices, and utilities. All by appointment only until the funds run out.

First come, first served and annually funded for rent and electricity assistance. Currently, the agency is working with 16 electric companies. Stop by and pick up an application and return it to the white box outside once it has been completely filled out. Should you need to update your contact information, you will need to set up an appointment. Heat/AC window units are sometimes available as well.

OrganizationName: St. Philip the Apostle Catholic Church
Services: Rent and utility financial assistance are available to zip codes78413 and 78414. Please call to set an appointment. The answering service will request you to leave your full name, the last four digits of your social security number, phone number, and reasons for assistance.

OrganizationName: Corpus Christi Development Services- Code Enforcement Division
Services: For rental property maintenanceissues, including rodent infestations, please contact the Code Enforcement Division of the Development Services Department.
